name: Eggplant
description: The eggplant is a delicate, tropical perennial plant often cultivated as a tender or half-hardy annual in temperate climates. The stem is often spiny. The flowers are white to purple in color, with a five-lobed corolla and yellow stamens.

plantInstructions.title: Choose the eggplant variety
plantInstructions.description: The first thing to do is to choose which type of eggplant you are going to grow, which can be determined or undetermined. While determinate eggplant have a compact plant, and limited growth, ideal for pots, indeterminate eggplant grow continuously and need to be pruned periodically.

plantInstructions.title: Sowe the eggplant
plantInstructions.description: eggplant should be sown from winter onwards, and should be planted in a protected place, such as the interior of the house or in a greenhouse, preferably in a heated seedbed. The seeds germinate in 7-10 days.
plantInstructions.photoDescription: Small eggplant plants planted in indoor pots

plantInstructions.title: Transplanting the eggplant
plantInstructions.description: About two months after planting, the tomatoes should be transplanted to a place where the plants will be more separated, and with fertilizer with many nutrients.
plantInstructions.photoDescription: Transplanting a eggplant plant from a pot to the ground

plantInstructions.title: Harvesting the eggplant
plantInstructions.description: About 4-5 months after transplanting, the eggplant will be ready to be harvested.
